HEADER.TITLE: Tone tutorial: verification of tone patterns for a monograph (later published as Michaud 2017), part 1 of 3: tables 5.6, 5.8 and 5.9

NOTE.message: Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.M.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: LM+L#
Beginning of Table 5.6: The tonal behaviour of the reduplicated suffix /-ʂo˧~ʂo˩/ depending on the tone of the preceding noun.
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.H.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: LH–
In Yongning Na, there is neutralization between L.M.L and L.H.L patterns, so the surface pattern could also be transcribed as L.M.L.
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.L.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: L+H#

W.TRANSL: full of grease, smeared with grease

NOTE.message: Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#

W.TRANSL: full of meat, rich in meat, with lots of meat

NOTE.message: Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#

W.TRANSL: full of mushrooms, packed with mushrooms

NOTE.message: Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.M.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: L#
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#

W.TRANSL: full of flies, swarming with flies

NOTE.message: Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#

W.TRANSL: full of paste, covered in paste

NOTE.message: Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.L.L.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: L+H#
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.L.L.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: L#–
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: LM+H#
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.M.M.H+L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: LM+H#
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.M.M.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: LM+L#

Translation as ‘sow’, indicated in the first edition of the book (Michaud 2017:219), is mistaken: the meaning of the word is ‘soybeans’. The word ‘sow’ belongs in the same category of disyllabic nouns as ‘soybeans’; the tables in the book were created by copying and pasting from previous tables, and the gloss failed to be corrected.
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: L.H.L.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: LH–
Surface tone pattern of suffixed form: M.H.L.L
Underlying phonological tone of suffixed form: H#–

W.TRANSL: full of youngsters, teeming with youngsters
